intro: Peucedanum canescens, commonly known as hoary angelica, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its finely hairy, gray-green leaves and tall, slender stems that bear small, yellowish-green flowers. Its roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, containing compounds with potential anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects. Peucedanum canescens thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
